pullRequest.body:
This defines `SSet.hoFunctor`, which constructs a category from a simplicial set.

Co-Authored-By: Emily Riehl <eriehl@jhu.edu>, Pietro Monticone <38562595+pitmonticone@users.noreply.github.com>, and JoÃ«l Riou <https://github.com/joelriou>

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).

I would suggest moving the file `AlgebraicTopology.HomotopyCat` to `AlgebraicTopology.SimplicialSet.HomotopyCat` (and then `SimplicalSet` should become `SimplicialSet.Basic`).

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#16779~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#16780~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#16781~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Note: Moving files to `SimplicialSet.*` should be done in a separate PR doing only that.

> Note: Moving files to `SimplicialSet.*` should be done in a separate PR doing only that.

See PR #17620.

> I think the new file can be wrapped in a `namespace SSet`.

@jcommelin to clarify, you were suggesting moving `HomotopyCat.lean` out of the `CategoryTheory` namespace and into the `SSet` namespace?

Sorry for being unclear. What I had in mind was to nest the namespaces:
```
namespace CategoryTheory
namespace SSet

...
```
because almost all the names start with `SSet.` already.

I would still insist that there is no reason to duplicate the construction. Before taking the quotient category, the two constructions are defeq. `HoRelâ‚‚` and `HoRel` (for the truncation) are obviously not defeq because there are separate types, but it would a very small effort to define `HoRel` in terms of `HoRelâ‚‚`.
What I suggest is define first the homotopy category for `2`-truncated simplicial sets. Define the homotopy category of a simplicial set by applying the previous construction to `(SimplexCategory.Truncated.inclusion 2).op â‹™ X`. Then, you may provide a nice helper API for the second construction if you want to hide the internals.
Please note that the truncation has good definitional properties.
@joelriou this makes the cuts that you requested and is now ready for review.

Two comments for @joelriou:

1. For whatever reason I have to write `SSet.Truncated.HomotopyCategory.quotientFunctor V` even in the `SSet.Truncated` namespace. 
2. I'm not sure how much of this file should be in the `Truncated` namespace. Eg. right now `HoRelâ‚‚` is in the `Truncated` namespace while `OneTruncationâ‚‚` is not. I'm not sure either of these choices is correct.
I may have figured out the issue: most of this file is actually in the `CategoryTheory.SSet.Truncated` namespace. Which further suggests I've made the namespaces all wrong.

> I may have figured out the issue: most of this file is actually in the `CategoryTheory.SSet.Truncated` namespace. Which further suggests I've made the namespaces all wrong.

Yes, it should be `SSet.Truncated` rather than `CategoryTheory.SSet.Truncated`.

@joelriou the current version adds the constructions of isomorphisms in `Quiv` and `ReflQuiv` as requested. 

Then the `HomotopyCat` file contains two versions of `OneTruncationâ‚‚.ofNerveâ‚‚.natIso` for comparison. The first version, starting line 119, is the one that uses the new infrastructure. Note, however, it causes a universe error I wasn't able to fix (though perhaps @digama0 can figure this out). The old version follows starting at line 184. Note I turned around the direction of the initial equivalence, we seemed to help, marginally.
I think the new file can be wrapped in a `namespace SSet`.
I think the new file can be wrapped in a `namespace SSet`.

It would be nice to prove this after `functor r` is defined, because it seems this could then be deduced from the fact that `Relation.EqvGen (@CompClosure C _ r X Y)` is, by the basic properties of quotients, the equivalence relation on `X âŸ¶ Y` such that `f` and `g` are related iff `(functor r).map f = (functor r).map g`. In general, we could also introduce `Functor.homRel` which sends a functor `F` from `C` to `D` to the relation on morphisms on `C` defined by `F.map f = F.map G`, and then we can prove `Congruence F.homRel` (all the fields can be obtained mostly `by aesop`). Then, up to a `rw`, this result would be the particular case `Congruence (functor r).homRel`.

@joelriou I believe I've now implemented all of your suggestions. See

+ Functor.homRel
+ Functor.homRelCongruence
+ functorHomRel_eq_compClosureEqvGen (better name?)
+ compClosure.congruence (I thought that perhaps this should have been lowercase, but maybe that is a mistake)
This notation is also defined in `SimplicialObject.lean`. What would happen if you add `priority := high` in `SimplicialObject.lean` and remove the declaration here?

```suggestion
  S.Î´ 1 f
```
Using `S.Î´` systematically in this file should improve readibility.

```suggestion
  S.Î´ 0 f
```

The API for simplicial sets should be expanded to include concrete formulations of the simplicial relations, like
```lean
@[simp]
lemma SSet.Î´_comp_Ïƒ_self_apply (S : SSet) {n} (i : Fin (n + 1)) (x : S _[n]) :
    S.Î´ i.castSucc (S.Ïƒ i x) = x :=
  congr_fun S.Î´_comp_Ïƒ_self x
```
Similarly, you should add lemmas like `Î´_naturality_apply`, `Ïƒ_naturality_apply`, which should ease many proofs below.
(This could go in a separate PR.)
Done except for the two naturality statements, which I forgot about, and added here.

Automation should take care of this:
```suggestion
```
If any case, adding a lemma like this would facilitate automation:
```lean
@[ext]
lemma hom_ext {S : SSet} {x y : SSet.OneTruncation S} {f g : x âŸ¶ y}
    (h : f.1 = g.1) : f = g := by
  cases f; cases g; subst h; rfl
```

It may be advisable to introduce a structure:
```lean
structure SSet.OneTruncation.Hom {S : SSet} (X Y : S _[0]) :=
  arrow : S _[1]
  src : src arrow = X := by aesop_cat
  tgt : tgt arrow = Y := by aesop_cat
```
Then, you may try to setup automation so that in most definitions, `src` and `tgt` are filled automatically.
Unfortunately, this doesn't work, it breaks the proof by refl that the OneTruncation and OneTruncationâ‚‚ definitions are equivalent.

```suggestion
  map_id X := by
    obtain âŸ¨x, rflâŸ© := X.mkâ‚€_surjective
    simp [map, ReflQuiver.id]
 ```

If the `ext` attribute of suitable lemmas is activated, I think that these proofs could become completely automatic (`by aesop_cat`):
```suggestion
  map := fun f => by
    refine âŸ¨.mkâ‚ f, ?_âŸ©
    constructor <;> apply ComposableArrows.extâ‚€ <;> simp <;> rfl
  map_id := fun X : C => Subtype.ext <| by
    apply ComposableArrows.extâ‚ <;> simp <;> rfl
```

It would be really nice to avoid duplication of code here. The only solution I see is to define the reflexive quiver and relations only in the case of a `S : SSet.truncated 2` and then, when we want to apply the construction to fully fledged simplicial sets, we just apply the truncation first. This may require developing the basic API of simplicial relations suggested above for the truncated simplicial objects/simplicial sets as well.

We think it would be better not to deal with this in this PR, but rather wait until we have some usage code before attempting such a refactor, because `OneTruncation` is not an opaque definition and we would prefer for users not to have to deal with the 2-truncation layer when they don't explicitly need it. Refactoring now could be making things harder elsewhere in code that does not exist yet.

```suggestion
```

Adding an `_iff` lemma should facilitate automation:
```suggestion
section

variable {C D : Type*} [Category C] [Category D] (F : C â¥¤ D) 

/-- A functor induces a `HomRel` on its domain, relating those maps that have the same image. -/
def Functor.homRel : HomRel C :=
  fun _ _ f g â†¦ F.map f = F.map g

@[simp]
lemma Functor.homRel_iff {X Y : C} (f g : X âŸ¶ Y) :
    F.homRel f g â†” F.map f = F.map g := Iff.rfl

end
```

This should be an instance:
```suggestion
instance Functor.congruence_homRel {C D : Type*} [Category C] [Category D] (F : C â¥¤ D) :
    Congruence F.homRel where
```

The `iff` lemma above makes this work:
```suggestion
  equivalence :=
    { refl := fun _ â†¦ rfl
      symm := by aesop
      trans := by aesop }
  compLeft := by aesop
  compRight := by aesop
```

There is a more direct proof. This is almost by definition of quotients:
```suggestion
theorem functor_homRel_eq_compClosure_eqvGen {X Y : C} (f g : X âŸ¶ Y) :
    (functor r).homRel f g â†” Relation.EqvGen (@CompClosure C _ r X Y) f g :=
  Quot.eq
```

```suggestion
  convert inferInstanceAs (Congruence (functor r).homRel)
  ext
  rw [functor_homRel_eq_compClosure_eqvGen]
```
Is this name intended to stay? Or is this WIP?
@digama0 what should this have been called?
I think it should be a `private lemma`. Perhaps `map_map_of_eq`?
Done.

I would recommend introducing a structure:
```suggestion
structure OneTruncationâ‚‚.Hom {S : SSet.Truncated 2} (X Y : OneTruncationâ‚‚ S) where
  edge : S _[1]â‚‚
  src_eq : S.map (Î´â‚‚ 1).op edge = X
  tgt_eq : S.map (Î´â‚‚ 0).op edge = Y
```

You may introduce a few lemmas like:
```lean
@[reassoc (attr := simp)]
lemma Î´â‚‚_one_comp_Ïƒâ‚‚_zero : Î´â‚‚ (1 : Fin 2) â‰« Ïƒâ‚‚ 0 = ðŸ™ _ := SimplexCategory.Î´_comp_Ïƒ_succ
```
Done.

It seems there is some unnecessary complication here:
```suggestion
inductive HoRelâ‚‚ {V : SSet.Truncated 2} :
    (X Y : Cat.FreeRefl (OneTruncationâ‚‚ V)) â†’ (f g : X âŸ¶ Y) â†’ Prop
```

I think it would be better not to use `.nil`, but the `Quiver.Hom.toPath` API:
```suggestion
    HoRelâ‚‚ _ _
      (Quot.mk _ (Quiver.Hom.toPath (ev02â‚‚ Ï†)))
      (Quot.mk _ ((Quiver.Hom.toPath (ev01â‚‚ Ï†)).comp
        (Quiver.Hom.toPath (ev12â‚‚ Ï†))))
```

```suggestion
  id X :=
    { edge := S.map (SSet.Ïƒâ‚‚ 0).op X
      src_eq := by
        simp only [â† FunctorToTypes.map_comp_apply, â† op_comp, Î´â‚‚_one_comp_Ïƒâ‚‚_zero,
          op_id, FunctorToTypes.map_id_apply]
      tgt_eq := by
        simp only [â† FunctorToTypes.map_comp_apply, â† op_comp, Î´â‚‚_zero_comp_Ïƒâ‚‚_zero,
          op_id, FunctorToTypes.map_id_apply] }
```

The proofs are found automatically:
```suggestion
```

```suggestion
@[simp]
lemma OneTruncationâ‚‚.id_edge {S : SSet.Truncated 2} (X : OneTruncationâ‚‚ S) :
    OneTruncationâ‚‚.Hom.edge (ðŸ™rq X) = S.map (SSet.Ïƒâ‚‚ 0).op X := rfl

/-- The functor that carries a 2-truncated simplicial set to its underlying refl quiver. -/
@[simps]
def oneTruncationâ‚‚ : SSet.Truncated.{u} 2 â¥¤ ReflQuiv.{u, u} where
  obj S := ReflQuiv.of (OneTruncationâ‚‚ S)
  map {S T} F := {
    obj := F.app (op [0]â‚‚)
    map := fun f â†¦
      { edge := F.app _ f.edge
        src_eq := by rw [â† FunctorToTypes.naturality, f.src_eq]
        tgt_eq := by rw [â† FunctorToTypes.naturality, f.tgt_eq] }
    map_id := fun X â†¦ OneTruncationâ‚‚.Hom.ext (by
      dsimp
      rw [â† FunctorToTypes.naturality]) }
```
Done.

I suspect that some definitions below would be faciliated by this:
```suggestion
@[simps]
def OneTruncationâ‚‚.nerveEquiv :
    C â‰ƒ OneTruncationâ‚‚ ((SSet.truncation 2).obj (nerve C)) where
  toFun X := .mkâ‚€ X
  invFun X := X.obj' 0
  left_inv _ := rfl
  right_inv _ := ComposableArrows.extâ‚€ rfl

def OneTruncationâ‚‚.nerveHomEquiv {X Y : C} : (X âŸ¶ Y) â‰ƒ (nerveEquiv X âŸ¶ nerveEquiv Y) where
  toFun f :=
    { edge := ComposableArrows.mkâ‚ f
      src_eq := ComposableArrows.extâ‚€ rfl
      tgt_eq := ComposableArrows.extâ‚€ rfl }
  invFun Ï† := eqToHom (congr_arg ComposableArrows.left Ï†.src_eq.symm) â‰« Ï†.edge.hom â‰«
      eqToHom (congr_arg ComposableArrows.left Ï†.tgt_eq)
  left_inv f := by dsimp; simp only [comp_id, id_comp]; rfl
  right_inv Ï† := by
    ext
    exact ComposableArrows.extâ‚ (congr_arg ComposableArrows.left Ï†.src_eq).symm
      (congr_arg ComposableArrows.left Ï†.tgt_eq).symm rfl
```

Instead of this lemma, I would think that the following may be more useful:
```lean
theorem HoRelâ‚‚.mk' {V : SSet.Truncated 2} (Ï† : V _[2]â‚‚) {Xâ‚€ Xâ‚ Xâ‚‚ : OneTruncationâ‚‚ V}
    (fâ‚€â‚ : Xâ‚€ âŸ¶ Xâ‚) (fâ‚â‚‚ : Xâ‚ âŸ¶ Xâ‚‚) (fâ‚€â‚‚ : Xâ‚€ âŸ¶ Xâ‚‚)
    (hâ‚€â‚ : fâ‚€â‚.edge = V.map (Î´â‚‚ 2).op Ï†) (hâ‚â‚‚ : fâ‚â‚‚.edge = V.map (Î´â‚‚ 0).op Ï†)
    (hâ‚€â‚‚ : fâ‚€â‚‚.edge = V.map (Î´â‚‚ 1).op Ï†) :
    HoRelâ‚‚ _ _ (Quot.mk _ (Quiver.Hom.toPath fâ‚€â‚‚))
      (Quot.mk _ ((Quiver.Hom.toPath fâ‚€â‚).comp (Quiver.Hom.toPath fâ‚â‚‚))) := by
  obtain rfl : Xâ‚€ = ev0â‚‚ Ï† := by
    rw [â† fâ‚€â‚‚.src_eq, hâ‚€â‚‚, â† FunctorToTypes.map_comp_apply, â† op_comp]
    rfl
  obtain rfl : Xâ‚ = ev1â‚‚ Ï† := by
    rw [â† fâ‚€â‚.tgt_eq, hâ‚€â‚, â† FunctorToTypes.map_comp_apply, â† op_comp]
    rfl
  obtain rfl : Xâ‚‚ = ev2â‚‚ Ï† := by
    rw [â† fâ‚â‚‚.tgt_eq, hâ‚â‚‚, â† FunctorToTypes.map_comp_apply, â† op_comp]
    rfl
  obtain rfl : fâ‚€â‚ = ev01â‚‚ Ï† := by ext; assumption
  obtain rfl : fâ‚â‚‚ = ev12â‚‚ Ï† := by ext; assumption
  obtain rfl : fâ‚€â‚‚ = ev02â‚‚ Ï† := by ext; assumption
  constructor
```

This allows the use of dot notation `V.HomotopyCategory`:
```suggestion
def _root_.SSet.Truncated.HomotopyCategory (V : SSet.Truncated.{u} 2) : Type u :=
  Quotient (HoRelâ‚‚ (V := V))
```
(An abbrev could be done in the `SSet` namespace so that we could also use `X.HomotopyCategory` when `X : SSet`.)

```suggestion
def _root_.SSet.Truncated.HomotopyCategory.quotientFunctor (V : SSet.Truncated.{u} 2) :
    Cat.FreeRefl (OneTruncationâ‚‚ V) â¥¤ V.HomotopyCategory :=
  Quotient.functor _ 
```

```suggestion
def SSet.Truncated.mapHomotopyCategory {V W : SSet.Truncated.{u} 2} (F : V âŸ¶ W) :
    V.HomotopyCategory â¥¤ W.HomotopyCategory :=
  Quotient.lift _
    ((oneTruncationâ‚‚ â‹™ Cat.freeRefl).map F â‹™ SSet.Truncated.HomotopyCategory.quotientFunctor W)
    (by
      rintro _ _ _ _ âŸ¨Ï†âŸ©
      apply Quotient.sound
      apply HoRelâ‚‚.mk' (Ï† := F.app _ Ï†)
        (fâ‚€â‚ := (oneTruncationâ‚‚.map F).map (ev01â‚‚ Ï†))
        (fâ‚€â‚‚ := (oneTruncationâ‚‚.map F).map (ev02â‚‚ Ï†))
        (fâ‚â‚‚ := (oneTruncationâ‚‚.map F).map (ev12â‚‚ Ï†))
      all_goals
        apply FunctorToTypes.naturality)
```
Done.
If would be good to have a constructor for isomorphisms in the category of quivers (resp. refl. quivers) which would take inputs like `nerveEquiv` and `nerveHomEquiv`.

I believe it would much more convenient to develop a suitable API (kind of similar to `eqToHom`) for quivers:
```lean
section

variable {V : Type*} [Quiver V]

def _root_.Quiver.homOfEq {X Y : V} (f : X âŸ¶ Y) {X' Y' : V}
    (hX : X = X') (hY : Y = Y') : X' âŸ¶ Y' := by
  subst hX hY
  exact f

@[simp]
lemma _root_.Quiver.homOfEq_trans
    {X Y : V} (f : X âŸ¶ Y) {X' Y' : V} (hX : X = X') (hY : Y = Y')
    {X'' Y'' : V} (hX' : X' = X'') (hY' : Y' = Y'') :
    Quiver.homOfEq (Quiver.homOfEq f hX hY) hX' hY' =
      Quiver.homOfEq f (hX.trans hX') (hY.trans hY') := by
  subst hX hY hX' hY'
  rfl

lemma _root_.Quiver.homOfEq_injective {X X' Y Y' : V} (hX : X = X') (hY : Y = Y')
    {f g : X âŸ¶ Y} (h : Quiver.homOfEq f hX hY = Quiver.homOfEq g hX hY) : f = g := by
  subst hX hY
  exact h

@[simp]
lemma _root_.Quiver.homOfEq_rfl {X Y : V} (f : X âŸ¶ Y) :
    Quiver.homOfEq f rfl rfl = f := rfl

end

-- this lemma may replace `Prefunctor.ext`
theorem _root_.Prefunctor.ext' {V W : Type u} [Quiver V] [Quiver W] {F G : Prefunctor V W}
    (h_obj : âˆ€ X, F.obj X = G.obj X)
    (h_map : âˆ€ (X Y : V) (f : X âŸ¶ Y),
      F.map f = Quiver.homOfEq (G.map f) (h_obj _).symm (h_obj _).symm) : F = G := by
  obtain âŸ¨Fobj, FmapâŸ© := F
  obtain âŸ¨Gobj, GmapâŸ© := G
  obtain rfl : Fobj = Gobj := funext h_obj
  simp only [Prefunctor.mk.injEq, heq_eq_eq, true_and]
  ext X Y f
  simpa only [Quiver.homOfEq_rfl] using h_map X Y f
```
Then, `isoOfEquiv` becomes:
```lean
namespace Quiv

section
variable {V W : Type u } [Quiver V] [Quiver W]
  (e : V â‰ƒ W) (he : âˆ€ X Y : V, (X âŸ¶ Y) â‰ƒ (e X âŸ¶ e Y))

include he in
@[simp]
lemma homOfEq_map_homOfEq {X Y : V} (f : X âŸ¶ Y) {X' Y' : V} (hX : X = X') (hY : Y = Y')
    {X'' Y'' : W} (hX' : e X' = X'') (hY' : e Y' = Y'') :
    Quiver.homOfEq (he _ _ (Quiver.homOfEq f hX hY)) hX' hY' =
      Quiver.homOfEq (he _ _ f) (by rw [hX, hX']) (by rw [hY, hY']) := by
  subst hX hY hX' hY'
  rfl

def isoOfEquiv : Quiv.of V â‰… Quiv.of W where
      hom := Prefunctor.mk e (he _ _)
      inv :=
        { obj := e.symm
          map {X Y} f := (he _ _).symm (Quiver.homOfEq f (by simp) (by simp)) }
      hom_inv_id := Prefunctor.ext' e.left_inv (fun X Y f â†¦ by
        dsimp [Quiv.id_eq_id, Quiv.comp_eq_comp]
        apply (he _ _).injective
        apply Quiver.homOfEq_injective (X' := e X) (Y' := e Y) (by simp) (by simp)
        simp)
      inv_hom_id := Prefunctor.ext' e.right_inv (by simp [Quiv.id_eq_id, Quiv.comp_eq_comp])

end
```
Thanks.

```suggestion
  hom_inv_id := by
    apply forgetToQuiv.map_injective
    exact e.hom_inv_id
  inv_hom_id := by
    apply forgetToQuiv.map_injective
    exact e.inv_hom_id
```

Above `forgetToQuiv.Faithful` should be made an instance.

```suggestion
@[simp]
theorem homOfEq_map {U V : Type*} [Quiver U] [Quiver V] (F : U â¥¤q V) {X Y : U} (f : X âŸ¶ Y)
```

After adding some API for isomorphisms in `Quiv`:
```lean
namespace Quiv

variable {V W : Quiv} (e : V â‰… W)

@[simps]
def equivOfIso : V â‰ƒ W where
  toFun := e.hom.obj
  invFun := e.inv.obj
  left_inv := Prefunctor.congr_obj e.hom_inv_id
  right_inv := Prefunctor.congr_obj e.inv_hom_id

@[simp]
lemma inv_obj_hom_obj_of_iso (X : V) :
    e.inv.obj (e.hom.obj X) = X :=
  (equivOfIso e).left_inv X

@[simp]
lemma hom_obj_inv_obj_of_iso (Y : W) :
    e.hom.obj (e.inv.obj Y) = Y :=
  (equivOfIso e).right_inv Y

lemma hom_map_inv_map_of_iso {V W : Quiv} (e : V â‰… W) {X Y : W} (f : X âŸ¶ Y) :
    e.hom.map (e.inv.map f) =
      Quiver.homOfEq f (by simp) (by simp) := by
  rw [â† Prefunctor.comp_map]
  exact (Prefunctor.congr_hom e.inv_hom_id.symm f).symm

lemma inv_map_hom_map_of_iso {V W : Quiv} (e : V â‰… W) {X Y : V} (f : X âŸ¶ Y) :
    e.inv.map (e.hom.map f) =
      Quiver.homOfEq f (by simp) (by simp) :=
  hom_map_inv_map_of_iso e.symm f

@[simps]
def homEquivOfIso {V W : Quiv} (e : V â‰… W) {X Y : V} :
    (X âŸ¶ Y) â‰ƒ (e.hom.obj X âŸ¶ e.hom.obj Y) where
  toFun f := e.hom.map f
  invFun g := Quiver.homOfEq (e.inv.map g) (by simp) (by simp)
  left_inv f := by simp [inv_map_hom_map_of_iso]
  right_inv g := by simp [hom_map_inv_map_of_iso]

end Quiv
```
The proof here becomes:
```suggestion
def isoOfQuivIso {V W : Type u} [ReflQuiver.{v + 1} V] [ReflQuiver.{v + 1} W]
    (e : Quiv.of V â‰… Quiv.of W)
    (h_id : âˆ€ (X : V), e.hom.map (ðŸ™rq X) = ReflQuiver.id (obj := W) (e.hom.obj X)) :
    ReflQuiv.of V â‰… ReflQuiv.of W where
  hom := ReflPrefunctor.mk e.hom h_id
  inv := ReflPrefunctor.mk e.inv
    (fun Y â†¦ (Quiv.homEquivOfIso e).injective
      (by simp [Quiv.hom_map_inv_map_of_iso, h_id]))
```

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).

source.title: feat(AlgebraicTopology/NerveAdjunction): nerve adjunction, Cat has colimits

nodes.body: I would suggest moving the file `AlgebraicTopology.HomotopyCat` to `AlgebraicTopology.SimplicialSet.HomotopyCat` (and then `SimplicalSet` should become `SimplicialSet.Basic`).

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#16779~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#16780~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#16781~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Note: Moving files to `SimplicialSet.*` should be done in a separate PR doing only that.

> Note: Moving files to `SimplicialSet.*` should be done in a separate PR doing only that.

See PR #17620.
I think the new file can be wrapped in a `namespace SSet`.

> I think the new file can be wrapped in a `namespace SSet`.

@jcommelin to clarify, you were suggesting moving `HomotopyCat.lean` out of the `CategoryTheory` namespace and into the `SSet` namespace?

Sorry for being unclear. What I had in mind was to nest the namespaces:
```
namespace CategoryTheory
namespace SSet

...
```
because almost all the names start with `SSet.` already.

I would still insist that there is no reason to duplicate the construction. Before taking the quotient category, the two constructions are defeq. `HoRelâ‚‚` and `HoRel` (for the truncation) are obviously not defeq because there are separate types, but it would a very small effort to define `HoRel` in terms of `HoRelâ‚‚`.
What I suggest is define first the homotopy category for `2`-truncated simplicial sets. Define the homotopy category of a simplicial set by applying the previous construction to `(SimplexCategory.Truncated.inclusion 2).op â‹™ X`. Then, you may provide a nice helper API for the second construction if you want to hide the internals.
Please note that the truncation has good definitional properties.
@joelriou this makes the cuts that you requested and is now ready for review.
